remixlab.proscene
Class InteractiveAvatarFrame

java.lang.Object
  remixlab.proscene.Frame
      remixlab.proscene.InteractiveFrame
          remixlab.proscene.InteractiveDrivableFrame
              remixlab.proscene.InteractiveAvatarFrame
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, MouseGrabbable, Trackable
public class InteractiveAvatarFrame
extends InteractiveDrivableFrame
implements Trackable

The InteractiveAvatarFrame class represents an InteractiveDrivableFrame that can be tracked by a Camera, i.e., it implements the Trackable interface.

The cameraPosition() of the camera that is to be tracking the frame (see the documentation of the Trackable interface) is defined in spherical coordinates (azimuth(), inclination() and trackingDistance()) respect to the Frame.position() (which defines its target()) of the InteractiveAvatarFrame.

Constructor Detail

InteractiveAvatarFrame

public InteractiveAvatarFrame(Scene scn)
Constructs an InteractiveAvatarFrame and sets its trackingDistance() to Scene.radius()/5, azimuth() to 0, and inclination() to 0.

See Also:
Scene.setAvatar(Trackable), Scene.setInteractiveFrame(InteractiveFrame)

cameraPosition

public PVector cameraPosition()
Overloading of Trackable.cameraPosition(). Returns the world coordinates of the camera position computed in computeCameraPosition().

Specified by:
cameraPosition in interface Trackable
Returns:
PVector holding the camera position defined in the world coordinate system.

upVector

public PVector upVector()
Overloading of Trackable.upVector(). Simply returns the frame Frame.yAxis().

Specified by:
upVector in interface Trackable
Returns:
PVector holding the camera up-vector defined in the world coordinate system.

target

public PVector target()
Overloading of Trackable.target(). Simply returns the frame Frame.position().

Specified by:
target in interface Trackable
Returns:
PVector holding the camera look-at vector defined in the world coordinate system.

computeCameraPosition

public void computeCameraPosition()
Overloading of Trackable.computeCameraPosition().

The cameraPosition() of the camera that is to be tracking the frame (see the documentation of the Trackable interface) is defined in spherical coordinates by means of the azimuth(), the inclination() and trackingDistance()) respect to the Frame.position().

Specified by:
computeCameraPosition in interface Trackable
